main event: Ground-radar observation of a cylindrical, dark gray object with irregular movement and a loud whining sound in Lagarfliot River, Iceland on 24 August 1954.
interesting points: The object was cylindrical in shape, dark gray in color, and emitted a loud whining sound, displaying irregular movement.
The observation was made through ground-radar by a civilian source with a length of observation being 1 unit of time.
The report indicates that attempts to track the object by the Air Defense Command failed due to a 5-10 week period from the point of record.
A photograph of a Naval Intelligence report from 23 November 1954 refers to an incident near Reykjavik, Iceland.

An egg-shaped unidentified object emitting a ball of fire was observed over a mountainous area near the Lagerfljot river in Iceland on 6 August 1954, estimated to be traveling at a speed between 800 & 1000 mph.
sighted object: a cylindrical, dark gray object emitting a loud whining sound
witnesses: civilian, Captain Solvi Johannsson of the Icelandic Coast Guard
